results.title: Lactic Acidosis Associated with Metformin in Patients with Diabetic Kidney Disease
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@Lactic Acidosis@@@ Associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetic_Nephropathies @DISEASE_MESH:D003928 @@@Diabetic Kidney Disease@@@

results.title: A Claims Database Analysis of Dose-Dependency of Metformin and Incidence of Lactic Acidosis in Japanese Patients with Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: The association between high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration (>= 1000 mg/day) and the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ was compared with that between low-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (< 1000 mg/day) or no @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration and @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ incidence by using the following approaches: a logistic regression analysis hypothesizing that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-associated @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ is short term; a time-dependent proportional hazard model hypothesizing that the influence of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is cumulative; and a case-control study in which @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ incidence was the case and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration within 3 months prior to the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ (or corresponding date for the control) was the exposure.

citations.NLM: Nagai Y, Kazumori K, Takeshima T, Iwasaki K, Tanaka Y. A Claims Database Analysis of Dose-Dependency of Metformin and Incidence of Lactic Acidosis in Japanese Patients with Type 2 Diabetes Diabetes Ther. 2021 Apr;12(4):1129-1141. PMID: 33677755
citations.BibTeX: @article{33677755, title={A Claims Database Analysis of Dose-Dependency of Metformin and Incidence of Lactic Acidosis in Japanese Patients with Type 2 Diabetes}, author={Nagai Y and Kazumori K and Takeshima T and Iwasaki K and Tanaka Y}, journal={Diabetes Ther}, volume={12}, number={4}, pages={1129-1141}}

results.title: Quality and Characteristics of 4241 Case Reports of Lactic Acidosis in Metformin Users Reported to a Large Pharmacovigilance Database
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-associated @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@MaLA@@@) occurs rarely and is thus difficult to study.

citations.NLM: Brand KMG, Schlachter J, Foch C, Boutmy E. Quality and Characteristics of 4241 Case Reports of Lactic Acidosis in Metformin Users Reported to a Large Pharmacovigilance Database Ther Clin Risk Manag. 2022;18():1037-1047. PMID: 36389204

results.title: Metformin-induced Lactic Acidosis Reported in the Youngest Pediatric Patient with Impaired Renal Function
results.text_hl: Here, we report a three-year-old female receiving therapeutic @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ who developed @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@MALA@@@.

results.title: Metformin toxicity: A meta-summary of case reports
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ associated @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@MALA@@@) was the most commonly reported adverse effect present in 224 (92.6%) @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Juneja D, Nasa P, Jain R. Metformin toxicity: A meta-summary of case reports World J Diabetes. 2022 Aug 15;13(8):654-664. PMID: 36159225

results.title: Hospitalization for Lactic Acidosis Among Patients With Reduced Kidney Function Treated With Metformin or Sulfonylureas
results.text_hl: After accounting for the main effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use, the independent effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ dose associated with @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ hospitalization was negligible.

citations.NLM: Chu PY, Hackstadt AJ, Chipman J, Griffin MR, Hung AM, Greevy RA Jr, Grijalva CG, Elasy T, Roumie CL. Hospitalization for Lactic Acidosis Among Patients With Reduced Kidney Function Treated With Metformin or Sulfonylureas Diabetes Care. 2020 Jul;43(7):1462-1470. PMID: 32327421
